snippet: Fresh fighting in Syria and growing fears of border closings are pushing record numbers to undertake a treacherous trek.

byline.contributor: Barbara Surk reported from Sentilj, Slovenia, and Spielfeld, Austria, and Rick Lyman from Warsaw. Bostjan Videmsek contributed reporting from Rigonce, Slovenia.
byline.original: By BARBARA SURK and RICK LYMAN

abstract: Record numbers of asylum-seekers are crossing borders of small Balkan nations on their way through Europe, overwhelming them; biggest current crunch is occurring on southern border of Slovenia, where some 83,600 migrants have arrived over past 10 days.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Fresh fighting in Syria and growing fears of border closings are pushing record numbers to undertake a treacherous trek.

headline.print_headline: Record Numbers of Migrants Enter Balkan Countries
headline.main: Balkans Reel as Number of Migrants Hits Record
